title: Even the Lord of Memes is not immune to being memed
body:
We all know that Chortling Carp has made his home here in Memes and Games. Although Chuckling Catfish has already acknowledged that even he must be memed. It's a shame that Cackling Cod will not be given credit for this wordplay. Guffawing Goldfish has already seen some of this work. And now, Giggling Guppy is the centerpiece of this exquisite use of synonymous substitution.

To Tittering Tuna, please accept this meme as tribute for being a continuous community member.

> To Tittering Tuna, please accept this meme as tribute for being a continuous community member.

I approve of this tribute. You have my thanks, Well-Endowed Succubus.

To be fair, Sharks are classified as fish.

Cackling Cod

Giggling Guppy
Tittering Tuna

Jesus Christ, here, take my upvote.
The big tuna has been called out

Ayyyy Big Tuna 


https://i.giphy.com/media/Wum5S3KP3PaYo/giphy.gif
Bless you both
https://i.giphy.com/media/xT5LMF4iH7JcCnGoA8/giphy.gif

The Howling Humuhumunukunukuāpuaʻa has been pleased!

(This is a real ass fish name. Look it up)
The sad part is that I now want to ask you HOW you know that's an actual fish name.

> [{quoted}](name=Busty Demoness,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=Lo4jKsOh,comment-id=00090000,timestamp=2019-03-13T02:01:22.816+0000)
>
> The sad part is that I now want to ask you HOW you know that's an actual fish name.

I used to be a pharmaceutical major at a college popular for veterinarian achievements. At the time we were breeding the fish to harvest them and turn them into an easy to access medicine. The fish is really great at helping with a lot of stuff. It just sucks it isn't more known about because people think it's a joke. 

Some of the ingredients in a lot of years-long birth control come from the fish and can be extracted without hurting them.
And here I was thinking this was a reference to High School Musical 2{{sticker:zombie-brand-facepalm}}

> [{quoted}](name=Busty Demoness,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=Lo4jKsOh,comment-id=00090000,timestamp=2019-03-13T02:01:22.816+0000)
>
> The sad part is that I now want to ask you HOW you know that's an actual fish name.

It's a popular "look at the long word I know; it's a Hawaiian fish" word. A friend in grade school had a shirt featuring it. Ah, good old memes.
Did Morgana enter a binding agreement with said succubus?
That's a good question.
Why would the "lord of memes" be immune to memes? Like what if the lord of fire couldn't be set on fire? What kind of lord of fire is that? a lame one that's what.

The idea was to introduce the rest of the meme.

And if a lord of fire isn't at least super resistant to flames (depending on circumstances), he's pretty lame as a lord of fire.
a real lord of fire could be set on fire on not get hurt!
Depends on context.
Context is for squares
Wouldn't that make him immune to fire tho?🤔🤔
Fish
\*Chortling Chub
Mildly amused Osteichthyes
I don't think you quite got the joke.
